original_solution_mapping.L1: He increases the length to 13+2=<<13+2=15>>15 feet
original_solution_mapping.L2: He increases the width to 18+2=<<18+2=20>>20 feet
original_solution_mapping.L3: So the rooms are 15*20=<<15*20=300>>300 square feet
original_solution_mapping.L4: So he has 1+3=<<1+3=4>>4 rooms of this size
original_solution_mapping.L5: So he has 4*300=<<4*300=1200>>1200 square feet of rooms this size
original_solution_mapping.L6: He also has one room of size 300*2=<<300*2=600>>600 square feet
original_solution_mapping.L7: So he has 1200+600=<<1200+600=1800>>1800 square feet of rooms

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6457.
    Returns: the total area of all rooms.
    """
    # L1
    initial_length = 13 # 13 feet
    length_increase = 2 # increases each dimension by 2 feet
    new_length = initial_length + length_increase

    # L2
    initial_width = 18 # 18 feet
    new_width = initial_width + length_increase

    # L3
    room_area = new_length * new_width

    # L4
    initial_room_count = 1 # James has a room
    additional_rooms = 3 # builds 3 more rooms
    total_equal_size_rooms = initial_room_count + additional_rooms

    # L5
    area_equal_size_rooms = total_equal_size_rooms * room_area

    # L6
    multiplier_for_twice_size = 2 # 1 room of twice that size
    area_twice_size_room = room_area * multiplier_for_twice_size

    # L7
    total_area = area_equal_size_rooms + area_twice_size_room

    # FA
    answer = total_area
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He increases the length to {initial_length}+{length_increase}=<<{initial_length}+{length_increase}={new_length}>>{new_length} feet
He increases the width to {initial_width}+{length_increase}=<<{initial_width}+{length_increase}={new_width}>>{new_width} feet
So the rooms are {new_length}*{new_width}=<<{new_length}*{new_width}={room_area}>>{room_area} square feet
So he has {initial_room_count}+{additional_rooms}=<<{initial_room_count}+{additional_rooms}={total_equal_size_rooms}>>{total_equal_size_rooms} rooms of this size
So he has {total_equal_size_rooms}*{room_area}=<<{total_equal_size_rooms}*{room_area}={area_equal_size_rooms}>>{area_equal_size_rooms} square feet of rooms this size
He also has one room of size {room_area}*{multiplier_for_twice_size}=<<{room_area}*{multiplier_for_twice_size}={area_twice_size_room}>>{area_twice_size_room} square feet
So he has {area_equal_size_rooms}+{area_twice_size_room}=<<{area_equal_size_rooms}+{area_twice_size_room}={total_area}>>{total_area} square feet of rooms
